name: Insecure Default Variable Initialization
description: The product, by default, initializes an internal variable with an insecure or less secure value than is possible.

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: insecure default variable initialization in BIOS firmware for a hardware board allows DoS

x_mitre_potential_mitigations.description: Disable or change default settings when they can be used to abuse the system. Since those default settings are shipped with the product they are likely to be known by a potential attacker who is familiar with the product. For instance, default credentials should be changed or the associated accounts should be disabled.
